metadata.title: CVE-2022-44792 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
handle_ipDefaultTTL in agent/mibgroup/ip-mib/ip_scalars.c in Net-SNMP 5.8 through 5.9.3 has a NULL Pointer Exception bug that can be used by a remote attacker (who has write access) to cause the instance to crash via a crafted UDP packet, resulting in Denial of Service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44792` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetsnmptrapd40 - 5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
libsnmp-base - 5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
libsnmp-perl - 5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
libsnmp40 - 5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
snmp - 5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
snmpd - 5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
snmptrapd - 5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
tkmib - 5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2').
